ARTICLE.COMMENT: Machine Learning: a description of the structure and learning methodology of a deep multi-layered architecture. YannLe Cun gives some examples for real-time video analysis.

X.T: Intelligence in Wikipedia

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Applying AI to try to semantically understand the Web, first by starting with Wikipedia to bootstrap the learning.

X.T: Autonomous Vehicle Driving from Italy to China

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Experimenting partially autonomous vehicles across Europe and Asia.

X.T: Evolving Neural Networks to Play 2048

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.

X.T: Rabbits, Faces & Hyperspaces - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A very basic introduction to multi-dimensional classification.

X.T: Deadly Truth of General AI? - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A science-fiction story to explain that an AI may do unexpected things in order to optimise its objective.

X.T: AI Self Improvement - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The possibility of a critical incident with a self-improving AI.

X.T: Go, Marvin Minsky, and the Chasm that AI Hasn’t Yet Crossed
X.ST: An expert in AI separates fact from hype in the wake of DeepMind’s victory over humans in the most challenging game of all

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some comments about the victory of DeepMind on the European champion of Go: MarvinMinsky was not opposed to neural networks, but challenged the provability that a network would converge; can the technology winning games be used in the real world?…

X.T: Jeu de go et intelligence artificielle — À chaud ! #2

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information about AlphaGo.

X.T: The Dark Secret at the Heart of AI
X.ST: No one really knows how the most advanced algorithms do what they do. That could be a problem.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Neural networks are a black box, we cannot explain their results, this will be a problem for some domains.

X.T: Google Cars versus Tesla (ft. Boi Faltings)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Google is using classical AI to decide how to drive, Telsa is using deep learning to mimic human drivers, Telsa’s solution is much faster to implement but cannot go as far as Google’s one, since it cannot do much better than what humans are currently doing.

X.T: The Brain Problem

ARTICLE.COMMENT: RobertCecilMartinUncle Bob claims that we are very far from reaching the processing power of a brain.

X.T: Is AI Riding a One-Trick Pony?
X.ST: Just about every AI advance you’ve heard of depends on a breakthrough that’s three decades old. Keeping up the pace of progress will require confronting AI’s serious limitations.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A short presentation of neural networks and backpropagation, their limits and some possible ways to overcome improve them.

X.T: The Netflix Prize (ft. Anne-Marie Kermarrec)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information about a Netflix competition for a better recommendation algorithm.

X.T: AI can be sexist and racist — it’s time to make it fair
X.ST: Computer scientists must identify sources of bias, de-bias training data and develop artificial-intelligence algorithms that are robust to skews in the data, argue James Zou and Londa Schiebinger.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: AI is biased because the data on which it is trained is biased. The authors suggest some directions to mitigate this.

X.T: AI & Logical Induction - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A high level description of an algorithm, similar to the finance market, assigning probabilities to logical statements.

X.T: Vers la conscience artificielle - Passe-science #24

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A theoretical explanation on how AI could reach consciousness.

X.T: Machine learning leads mathematicians to unsolvable problem
X.ST: Simple artificial-intelligence problem puts researchers up against a logical paradox discovered by famed mathematician Kurt Gödel.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some researchers proved that a simple AI problem is equivalent to the continuum hypothesis.

X.T: Une intelligence artificielle peut-elle être créative ?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.

X.T: Untold History of AI: How Amazon’s Mechanical Turkers Got Squeezed Inside the Machine
X.ST: Today’s unseen digital laborers resemble the human who powered the 18th-century Mechanical Turk

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The history of Amazon’s Mechanical Turk and the role of these workers in the AI current progress.

X.T: Rajat Monga: TensorFlow
Rajat Monga: TensorFlow | Lex Fridman Podcast #22

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The past and the future of TensorFlow.

X.T: Vectoring Words (Word Embeddings) - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The basics of word embedding.

X.T: EXTRA BITS: More Word Embeddings - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The continuation of the previous video.

X.T: AI Safety Gym - Computerphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The problem of having safe AIs and the Safety Gym benchmark proposed by OpenAI.

X.ST: “Deep-speare” crafted Shakespearean verse that most readers couldn’t distinguish from human-written poems

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of Deep-speare, an AI writing sonnets.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some marketing for Duplex: calling businesses to update their opening hours, booking restaurants and salons, screening calls…

X.T: L'éthique des algorithmes en sérieux danger

ARTICLE.COMMENT: TimnitGebru has been fired by Google, LêNguyên Hoang states once again the importance of research on the ethics of AI.

X.T: Google démantèle son éthique (et tout le monde s'en fout...)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Two months later, Google also fires MargarettMitchell.

X.T: What Really Happened When Google Ousted Timnit Gebru
X.ST: She was a star engineer who warned that messy AI can spread racism. Google brought her in. Then it forced her out. Can Big Tech take criticism from within?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A long article about TimnitGebru: her biography, what she did at Google, and her firing.

X.T: On Racialized Tech Organizations and Complaint: A Goodbye to Google

ARTICLE.COMMENT: AlexHanna explains why she resigns from Google because of the whiteness of its organisational practices.

X.T: Trajectoires #19 : IA et apprentissage du langage avec Aliyah Morgenstern

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The differences on how a child or an AI learns a language.

X.T: Why You Should Want Driverless Cars On Roads Now

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The usual arguments in favour of autonomous cars.

X.T: Transformers, explained: Understand the model behind GPT, BERT, and T5

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A basic presentation of transformers.

X.T: 7 Revealing Ways AIs Fail
X.ST: Neural networks can be disastrously brittle, forgetful, and surprisingly bad at math

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some problems with the current AI algorithms.

X.T: Deep Learning’s Diminishing Returns
X.ST: The cost of improvement is becoming unsustainable

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The energy/cost of training deep neural networks is getting higher very quickly, so it is unrealistic to expect the current race done by using larger and larger networks can continue, some technology changes must happen.

X.T: We Were Right! Real Inner Misalignment

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The problem when an AI system is not targetting the expected objective.

X.T: L’intelligence artificielle dans tous ses états

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some well-known facts about AI.

X.T: Comment les I.A. font-elles pour comprendre notre langue ?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An introduction on natural language processing using deep learning.

X.T: Comment les IA comprennent-elles notre langue ? Le traitement du langage naturel

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some very little information complementing the previous video.

X.T: Google's 'DeepMind' does Mathematics
Google's 'DeepMind' does Mathematics - Numberphile Podcast

ARTICLE.COMMENT: DeepMind detects some patterns in knot theory and proposes some conjectures than mathematicians can try to prove.

X.T: AI Training Is Outpacing Moore’s Law
X.ST: The new set of MLPerf results proves it

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A list of benchmark measurements indicating that performance is improving quickly.

X.T: AI’s 6 Worst-Case Scenarios
X.ST: Who needs Terminators when you have precision clickbait and ultra-deepfakes?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A list of problems with AI. There is nothing new here: these issues are often talked about.

X.T: Uncovering the Secrets of the Past with AI

ARTICLE.COMMENT: AI is used to help reading or rebuild ancient texts.

X.T: Machine Learning Reimagines the Building Blocks of Computing
X.ST: Traditional algorithms power complicated computational tools like machine learning. A new approach, called algorithms with predictions, uses the power of machine learning to improve algorithms.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An example of combining a classical algorithm with a neural network.

X.T: Stream sciences #1 : peut-on transférer sa conscience dans un ordinateur ?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The first minutes are promising, but then there is no interesting information in this chat: the subject is too much simplified and the discussion is messy.

X.T: LA TRADUCTION AUTOMATIQUE NEURONALE VA-T-ELLE REMPLACER LES HUMAINS ?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: This presentation is mostly a list of anecdotes.

X.T: Machine Learning 1: Tour d'horizon et le cas MuZero (feat Dalle2, PaLM) - Passe-science #47

X.T: TAY : L'INTELLIGENCE ARTIFICIELLE DEVENUE NAZIE EN 24H SUR TWITTER

X.T: We Don’t Need to Reinvent our Democracy to Save it from AI

X.T: The Internet Isn’t Completely Weird Yet; AI Can Fix That
X.ST: “Model collapse” looms when AI trains on the output of other models

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A simplistic experiment to demonstrate that using AI-generated data to train AI will end up generating garbage. It is obvious that the fact that the data scrapped to train AI will contain more and more AI-generated data and this will have some effects, but these ones will be more subtle that what is demonstrated here.
